reviews.text: The Hampton Inn Soho is a newer hotel. We originally booked two rooms here for three people as we were concerned the rooms would be tiny. One room was a king sized room #1006 and one was a double #1107.
reviews.title: Great stay at the right price.

reviews.text: Overall this was a nice smaller hotel, with easy access to the subway, Soho, and Chinatown. It was easy to get to from Grand Central via the subway and is just short walk from the station. There is not much around the location, but a block or two away are some pubs and restaurants. Breakfast was included in the room, and was pretty good for a continental breakfast. Food and drink was plentiful with plenty of seats. The bar was not up and running yet. The elevators are kind of slow, but not a big deal. Front desk staff was quite friendly.
reviews.title: OK hotel with great location

reviews.text: In general for both rooms, the beds were comfortable, the bathrooms were nice, and overall the rooms were clean and in good shape. The heating/cooling units seemed to be less modern and older than the actual hotel and were inefficient at getting a comfortable temperature and quite loud. Each room had two wardrobe type storage chests and a nice HD flat screen television. The rooms DO NOT have wifi, but do have an Internet hookup. Wifi is only available in the lobby areas.
reviews.title: Great deal and close to Soho

reviews.text: The king sized room was very small, would be fine for two people, ie a couple. There was not much in terms of storage if you have a lot of luggage and not much floor space. The bathroom was a little smaller and nicer in this room. This room, as do the even numbered rooms, faced the holland tunnel side of the building. These rooms are definitely louder than the other side of the hotel. I did not get much sleep in this room, and I was really only there on off peak travel hours, try to get an odd room if you can.
reviews.title: Way above expectations!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The 2nd room was a double room, on the back side of the hotel (1107) it had a great view of the city and was quite large. We had plenty of room for 3 people on the 2nd night there. Again storage could be an issue if you have a lot of stuff with you, but we were ok for the weekend. The room was much much quieter and more comfortable. Again I'd recommend trying for the odd numbered room and a double if you can get one.
reviews.title: Small rooms, not so clean, but friendly staff

reviews.text: This is the second time we've stayed at this Hampton Inn location. It is centrally located to everything I want to do and more importantly, close to my friends who live in the City.
reviews.title: We love this place!

reviews.text: Yes the rooms are small but it's not that bad. This location is much quieter than the Seaport location and the staff is extremely accommodating.
reviews.title: QUIET LOCATION
A bit of a let down.
reviews.text: Beds are comfortable and room is clean.
We would stay in this location anytime it is available. I am a Hilton employee travelling on my hotel benefits.
reviews.title: Tremendous staff and great location

reviews.text: Mahalo!
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: I stayed with 2 friends at this hotel in SoHo for a girls' weekend in NYC. The location was perfect for us since everything we wanted to do was downtown. We never made it past 23rd Street. We could walk to the village and Chelsea easily from this location. (We are walkers) The room was small but all rooms in Manhattan are on the smaller side. You don't need space for a fun trip to NYC since you should be out and about. The room was very clean and the bathroom was a decent size with a full tub if you need to soak your feet after a long day of walking. The free breakfast had a lot to offer and the coffee was surprisingly good. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Great Location in Soho

reviews.text: American television is fond of the commericial break, it seems every five minutes you're forced to watch a middle-aged dude yell the virtues of the latest wart cream or constipation aid, all with a smile that sits at odds with blatent embaressment of such products. During my stay in New York i recall one commerical inparticular; it was for a realtor and the basic premise of it was the fact they provided an array of services that no rival could match and the shiny-toothed lady said the line "why don't all companies have this". Well that was what I found myself saying alot while staying at the Hampton Inn Manhattan Soho, with particular regard to the complimentary breakfast. On offer was a wide selection of pastries, fruit, juices, coffees and cereals. It was a wonderful start to each day, and also a good way of intereacting with staff and other guests.
reviews.title: Rather awesome!! Infact better than warts and constiation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was large, clean and modern, although a little noisy, not so much outside noise but from other rooms, I guess the hotel can only work with what's it got and what it's got is paper walls. Not a big deal but worth noting if you're the type of grumpy fool who gets annoyed easily. All the staff were helpful and knowledgable about the local area. The hotel has two computers in the lobby for guest use which was great for keeping in contact with home. There is also a gym in the lower floor although I have no idea what's it like, I got enough exercise walking around Manhattan Island!
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Great Non Touristy Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those who desire to add calories to their body rather than remove them there is a trendy hotel bar next to the lobby which would be a cool hangout in the evening. However, at the time of my stay it was still awaiting an alcohol license so if you like the juice better call before booking to make sure you won't be dry. It's no big deal though you're in the middle of some of New York's trendiest areas. Although the hotel itself is located on a rather bland street you're only a few blocks from Soho, TriBeCa and most notably the latest place to be, Greenwich Village. Worth checking out for the range of stylish restuarants, boutique shops and friendly atmosphere. For travelling further afield there are red and blue line subway stations within 5 minutes walk. Some advice though; when coming back to the hotel only local trains stop at these stations, if you catch an express you'll be walking alot further (believe me!).
reviews.title: Enjoyed Night at Hampton Inn SoHo

reviews.text: We got an excellent rate on this hotel, certainly the cheapest in this area and a freakin' steal considering the quality of the hotel. It's a new place (well a refurbished and rebranded one anyway) so has been offering some awesome deals to get itself on the map. How long this will continue I don't know but i would certainly still stay there. Overall it offered the perfect base from which to explore New York.
reviews.title: Great hotel in SoHo

reviews.text: THe hotel was very good for the price. We stayed for 7 days. The rooms are clean and the breakfest is rich of fresh fruits and breads. The staff is friendly and helpfull and there is interent all over the hotel. The hotel is very close to public transfer (NY Lines: red 1,2,3 ), three streets away you will find the Canal street where you can dine cheap in fast food restaurants.
reviews.title: Great Stay
Hampton Inns Soho "The place to stay in the big apple"
reviews.text: To come all the way from Belfast,Ireland, to New York, We were made very welcome from the very friendly and efficient staff. No matter what we asked of them it was no trouble the assist. The buffet breakfast in the morning and hot beverages any time of day was great and welcome after a long day out in town. Great location, right next to Canal St, great shopping, and bus and subway at the corner. Two stops away from Financial District. What more could you want. Great deal on the hotel. The only issue was, there were four of us and the room was a bit small. Should have booked two rooms, but price suited better with 4 sharing. Would definitely go back and highly recommend it. Breakfast a real bonus to start the day if you want to be out and about early.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for a weekend in May 2009. If you are aware of the Soho layout, it's a great spot. Near many restaurants, shopping, subways. Easy to find just off 6th Ave and Canal. Rooms were new and nice, normal NYC small. Shower only in our room which I like, but some may not. Service staff was friendly, but WAY understaffed. They just couldn't keep up. However overall the stay was very nice if you are just looking for a good location and nice bed before heading back out into the city.
reviews.title: Great Soho location, nice rooms, limit service

reviews.text: I recently stayed at this hotel with some friends and am pleased to say I was very
reviews.title: great hotel - super value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: pleasantly suprised. On arrival we were greeted by a very pleasant and helpful girl on
reviews.title: If you know NYC, the location is great. If you're a newbie tourist, stay somewhere else.

reviews.text: This hotel had a golden opportunity to shine and it fail miserably in its effort. I had placed a reservation albeit a third-party website but upon arrival the prepaid reservation was not in Hampton's system. Mind you, the travel time was four plus hours. There was only one person that cared enough to help me the first night but no one else cared and I had to find another room at a different hotel. Hopefully my experience will not be a repeat for anyone else but after my ordeal this hotel's reputation is tarnished.
reviews.title: Not a great experience.

reviews.text: We stayed here last year in December for a week, rooms were clean, great bathroom and the bed was also of good quality. Location is amazing, underground close-by same for the Uggs store :-). We enjoyed complimentary Internet & Breakfast which is most important. Overall, great stay and great service. We loved it!
reviews.title: Great Stay in Hampton Inn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I love visiting manhattan. I try to make it a couple times a year. My recent favorite location to stay is in the Soho area. We find ourselves gravitating here away from the tourists and toward the bars and restaurants of lower manhattan so why not stay near? Well the main reason not to stay is that prices have really begun to rise here. We obviously are not the only ones who like this area.
reviews.title: Great value if you can snag a good rate

reviews.text: This hotel is a perfect example of this. A couple years ago you could usually grab a room here for under 200$ a night. Now you might pay 3-400$. Now for New York this isn't too crazy but for a Hampton Inn? Well i'll let you decide that.
reviews.title: Hotel in SoHo, NY

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I like the hotel. Its more modern than most, minimalistic with a front desk, some elevators and a bar to the side. The rooms are better than most for the money and the location puts your close to a subway line. The location is a bit odd and may be hard to find at first because it is tucked in the southwest corner of the island and near the Holland Tunnel.
reviews.title: Nice for a short stay.
Perfect location, Hidden gem
reviews.text: One of the best-priced hotels for it's type in NYC, this Hampton Inn is perfectly situated on the border of Soho,Tribeca and West Village and close to great subways, which makes it easy to get around. Also has a great roof view and a wonderful staff who watched our luggage both before check-in and after check-out. They have free breakfast although we didn't use it. Would return again if we return to Soho!

Great location...the staff at the service desk were great in all areas...easy to find right as you get out of the holland tunnel...parking close by...breakfast included....great deal and close to great areas.. excellent access to the tunnel when leaving the area, tunnell just a few blocks from hotel
reviews.title: great location and hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and we were totally satisfied. The area is great, next to some great places to eat and a short walk to the metro. The rooms were fairly small but very clean, shower was nice and big and the quality of furnishings was much nicer than other low cost hotels ( we have stayed in a few on this trip) the big bonus staying here was the free breakfast- it was really good, lots of choice: fruit, baked goods, cooked brekkie. Wifi was reliable and fast. Will definitely use again if on a short visit!
reviews.title: Excellent value and location!

reviews.text: I did not know what to expect of this hotel as the lcoation is one that I am familair with only on my way to the Holland Tunnel. Fortunately, I had a room on a high floor facing north, so I did not get the street noise. The room was comfortable and I got a good night's sleep. Check-in was efficient and the upgrade as a Hilton HHonors gold member was appreciated.
reviews.title: Great location,pleasant staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel location is convenient to the Canal St. subway stop and within walking distance of several neighborhoods. I thought the value was good for the price and I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Get a feel for SoHo and Tribeca

reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights in 4/09. Great value for Soho location; all other decent hotels were $250 and up per night. Hotel was easy to find with website directions; parking a couple blocks away. We had a room with two doubles facing Watts St. on the tenth floor. No problems with noise from Watts St., even on a weekend night. The room was of a good size, with plenty of space for the three of us. Breakfast on our first morning was good; fresh fruit, pastries, bagels, cereal, yogurt and a hot dish. The second morning, it looked a little tired. The fruit looked like it was from the day before and the hot dish did not look quite so fresh. But, plenty of yogurt, bagels, juice etc. Staff were always courteous and helpful. Location of this hotel is pefect; a quick stroll from the heart of Soho shopping and eating; also a great location to hop on the subway at Spring St. and head uptown. I would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great deal for Soho Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We checked in very early after a red-eye flight for an 8 night stay. The room was between the elevator and the electrical room. We were initially concerned about potential noise, which was unwarranted.
reviews.title: Nice hotel

reviews.text: Pros:
reviews.title: Poor service, tiny rooms, and I hope you don't want to take a bath...

reviews.text: Outside mid-town Manhanttan
reviews.title: Great , reasonably priced

reviews.text: A few blocks from Soho and all it has to offer
reviews.title: very nice hotel/good price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a second home for me, the place where I always stay and hope to always stay whenever I come to NYC (which is several times a year). Amazing staff, always ready to help in any way possible to make the stay as pleasant as possible.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn SoHo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located next to several subway entrances and in beautiful SoHo. The best part of our trip was wandering around the neighborhood and seeing all the little shops and places to eat. We felt pretty safe walking back to the hotel at night. I liked that it was away from all the craziness in midtown. It was a little bit noisy in the room because of the A/C but not a huge issue. The bathroom was a decent size and the bed was comfortable. Staff was helpful and friendly. They hold your luggage for you before check in and after check out. Amelia's is a brunch spot close by which we liked. Get a metrocard for the week and you can pretty much get to wherever you want to go. Took a taxi to the hotel from JFK but next time I would definitely just take the Airtrain to Howard and then the A train which drops off in Canal St., very close by. So much cheaper than a taxi and not too much trouble if you only have one piece of luggage. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would come back in a heartbeat.
reviews.title: Great hotel for a great price

reviews.text: The staff here is very nice. My room was up to date and above par. The room was quiet and clean. There was a little traffic noise one night because of a backup in the Holland Tunnel. I found lots to do close by. Easy access the the running path along the Westside Hwy, which is terrific. Plenty of places for dining close by and an easy walk. No complaints and would stay here again.
reviews.title: Solid hotel, no complaints
Location + space = success
reviews.text: I was so happy here. I didn't think I would like a Hampton Inn, but this location is perfect. The lobby is tiny and its so easy to get in and out of the hotel. My room was very impressive. Large and open with a huge terrace. Splurge for the 19th floor terrace room. It's so worth it. The view is amazing. Empire State Building, Chrysler building, midtown skyline, Hudson River all at ur back window. The view is even better than the public terrace outside your door. The construction in the lobby was unobtrusive. The cafe that is being worked on wouldn't be a place you would want to go anyway.

We visited during renovation yet it was not loud. Hotel did need renovating. Rooms are small but clean.exercise room in basement but no pool. Staff helpful. Would stay more uptown like Chelsea or Greenwich next time to be closer to sites but traffic was quieter hw
reviews.title: Quiet basic hotel off the beaten path
